Sentencas: The degradation of anodes of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), which consist of a porous metal - solid electrolyte material is described by a two particle model.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model is based on two main assumptions.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Firstly, the difference in metal particle diameter is the driving force for the observed coarsening of the larger metal particle during long term annealing.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Secondly, surface diffusion of metal atoms on the particle surface is the dominant diffusion mechanism.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Additionally, a function was introduced which considers the limited space for the growth of the nickel particles in the cermet material.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The found analytical function for the growth kinetics was compared to experimental results for the growth of nickel particles in a nickel - yttria stabilised zirconia (YSZ) anode annealed at 1000 degreesC up to 4000 h.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model describes the time dependence of the observed particle radii in an adequate way.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The resultant surface diffusion coefficients for Ni are lower than results found in literature.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells
Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the result shows that the proposed mechanism - surface diffusion of nickel atoms - is fast enough to explain the found amount of Ni agglomeration in SOFC anodes and is therefore considered to be the dominant mechanism.
Titulo: Modelling of the agglomeration of Ni-particles in anodes of solid oxide fuel cells
